name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On August 28, according to Australian Financial Review and Sydney Today, Uber drivers in Australia went on strike to protect their rights due to a drop in income. As a result, most Chinese drivers not only did not participate in the offline protest, but also "took advantage" to accept orders crazily, and even posted their orders online, which attracted criticism. A Melbourne driver angrily said, "What is the difference between this behavior and that of a rat?"

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On August 29, at the regular press conference of the Ministry of National Defense, a reporter asked about the claim by the commander of the US Indo-Pacific Command that it could escort Philippine ships for replenishment. The Ministry of National Defense responded to the US and the Philippines with "Black Myth: Wukong".

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: August 24 (Released), Linxia Hui Autonomous Prefecture, Gansu Province. A man repeatedly beat a young child with a belt.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Sichuan has been experiencing hot weather recently, with the highest temperature in most parts of the basin at 39-41 degrees Celsius. Education bureaus in Leshan, Meishan, Nanchong and other places have successively notified the delay of school opening, while the Chengdu Education Bureau has been slow to respond, causing dissatisfaction among many students, who complained on social platforms.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On August 26, Shangguan Zhengyi, a well-known anti-trafficking volunteer, wrote that Shandong Qingdao Chunyun IVF Consulting Co., Ltd. and Qingdao Meike Biotechnology Co., Ltd. colluded with medical staff from tertiary hospitals to practice medicine illegally. Under the guise of IVF, they actually engaged in illegal surrogacy and sale of birth certificates, and their business involved the entire country.
